record.title: MORNING BUSINESS

speaking.paragraph: In that case, Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that we now move off the bill, move to morning business, and that Senators Graham and Lieberman be recognized and then Senator Sanders be recognized.
Mr. President, if I might say to my colleague, Senator Graham has an airplane he is trying to catch.
Mr. President, I wonder if Senator Graham could speak for just a few minutes, and then we could turn to Senator Sanders and then to Senator Lieberman.
Mr. President, I ask Senator Graham, how many minutes does he wish?

Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that we now move off the bill and go to morning business and that Senator Graham be recognized for 3 minutes and then Senator Sanders be recognized for up to 20 minutes. I want Senator Lieberman to hear that request.
I say to the Senator, I listened to your speech.
That Senator Sanders be recognized for up to 20 minutes and Senator Lieberman be recognized for up to 20 minutes. That is my unanimous consent request.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The Senator from South Carolina is recognized.
